pullRequest.body:
This PR adds the definition of the dual of a matroid and co-independent sets, as well as some notation and API. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7187966777/job/19576664551)

Once you get the linting errors fixed:

bors d+

:v: apnelson1 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
Already running a review

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7188882683/job/19579400366)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7188882683/job/19579400172)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7188882683/job/19579400573)

Thanks, nice to see `M﹡﹡ = M`!

bors r+

I think someone more fastidious about names might have something to say about them -- how about if there are concerns by another reviewer, please leave them here and we'll make a followup refactoring PR?

Thanks, nice to see `M﹡﹡ = M`!

bors r+

I think someone more fastidious about names might have something to say about them -- how about if there are concerns by another reviewer, please leave them here and we'll make a followup refactoring PR?
Do you intend to have more than one instance of this class? If not, you could define the notation to use `Matroid.dual` directly and simplify things.
Given `dual_ground`, are these theorems needed? I don't know exactly what aesop can do.

```suggestion
        ←inter_eq_self_of_subset_left hB''.subset_ground, inter_right_comm, inter_assoc]
```

```suggestion
    M﹡.Indep I ↔ (∃ B, M.Base B ∧ Disjoint I B) := by
  rw [dual_indep_iff_exists', and_iff_right hI]
```

```suggestion
theorem dual_dep_iff_forall : (M﹡.Dep I) ↔ (∀ B, M.Base B → (I ∩ B).Nonempty) ∧ I ⊆ M.E := by
  simp_rw [dep_iff, dual_indep_iff_exists', dual_ground, and_congr_left_iff, not_and,
    not_exists, not_and, not_disjoint_iff_nonempty_inter, imp_iff_right_iff, iff_true_intro Or.inl]
```
This appears to be `subset_dual_ground_of_subset_ground`

```suggestion
theorem setOf_dual_base_eq : {B | M﹡.Base B} = (fun X ↦ M.E \ X) '' {B | M.Base B} := by
```

```suggestion
theorem dual_inj {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} (h : M₁﹡ = M₂﹡) : M₁ = M₂ := by
  rw [←dual_dual M₁, h, dual_dual]
```
And could you move this theorem to after `dual_dual`? The two after that should move too.

```suggestion
abbrev Coindep (M : Matroid α) (I : Set α) : Prop := M﹡.Indep I
```

Underscores aren't allowed in defition names:
```suggestion
@[simps] def dualIndepMatroid (M : Matroid α) : IndepMatroid α where
```

```suggestion
theorem dual_involutive : Function.Involutive (dual : Matroid α → Matroid α) := dual_dual
  
theorem dual_injective : Function.Injective (dual : Matroid α → Matroid α) :=
  dual_involutive.injective

@[simp] theorem dual_inj {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} : M₁﹡ = M₂﹡ ↔ M₁ = M₂ :=
  dual_injective.eq_iff
```
or similar. I would guess the two lemmas below also follow from `dual_involutive`.
You should add `Indep.coindep` too for symmetry.

Conventionally this lemma is called
```suggestion
@[simp] theorem dual_inj {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} : M₁﹡ = M₂﹡ ↔ M₁ = M₂ :=
```
This lemma is defeq to `dual_injective`; I don't think there's any need to have both.

Proofs should be indented two not four spaces:
```suggestion
  dual_coindep_iff.2 hI
```

`\` is usually called `sdiff`:
```suggestion
theorem coindep_iff_subset_sdiff_base : M.Coindep X ↔ ∃ B, M.Base B ∧ X ⊆ M.E \ B := by
```

I've already thought about this one a bit - I think the deviation from convention is warranted here. 

The operation really is a 'complementation within the ground set', and would always be thought of as such by anyone with any cause to be using this lemma. Actual complementation is rare in the matroid API, because it gives sets containing junk. 

Also, is it `sdiff` or `diff`? Different parts of mathlib can't seem to agree on this (even just in the `Set` API).

If you make sure that `M.E \ x` is documented to be `compl`, then that seems fine to me. I'd almost go as far as define the abbreviation `M.compl B` for this, but that might make things more difficult to work with.

Usually lemma names are named after their statement; it's a bit jarring to me that the statements are about `E` but the lemma is named `ground`. That's out of scope for this PR, but I think it would be better to use the same name in both places, like we do everywhere else.

This came up with the initial matroid PR, and is briefly addressed in the docstring of `basic`. The reason I did things this way is that writing `M.ground` everywhere in place of `M.E` would be unwieldy, but writing `E` in lemma names would be cryptic. For the same reason, the set in question is always denoted `E` or `E(M)` in pen-and-paper mathematics, but is referred to as the 'ground set of `M`' in speech or prose. 

This issue is really an indirect consequence of the decision to have the carrier set distinct from the ambient type, which is also something that doesn't really happen elsewhere in mathlib - recall the discussion here:

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Matroids.20in.20mathlib.20-.20feedback.3F
Yeah, `ground` is documented in the module docstring for `Matroid.Basic`. (Maybe you want to create a naming conventions section to put these in one place for reference.)
Generally `refine foo ?_` is preferred over `refine' foo _`

```suggestion
theorem eq_dual_iff_dual_eq {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} : M₁ = M₂﹡ ↔ M₁﹡ = M₂ :=
  dual_involutive.eq_iff.symm
```
(untested)

Naming convention warning: this would often be `base_dual_iff`, since at least for data, the fact you used dot notation isn't taken into account for the order.

This sometimes goes both ways, and also `@[simps]` doesn't generate the "right" order, so I'll let it go for now, but someone might come along and rename it in a future refactoring.
ok, thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: matroid duality
